page.title: 05Farming
page.content: All 4 farms use tractors to pull ploughs,cultivators,fertilisers,sprays, drills etc. and all except Church Farm have their own combine harvesters.The newer tractors have 4-wheel drive and reversible ploughs now make ploughing quicker.In the yard of Church Farm is a newly renovated 1864 Ransome Newcastle Prize Plough,a light land,horse-drawn plough which was used here until 1950 and cost 4 pounds 5 shillings when new. Naturally the large farm group owns the most up to date machines including 2 industrial shovels, a low ground pressure vehicle for winter use,a forage harvester,a direct seed drill, automatic cluster removers for milking and their second combine harvester is of a revolutionary design only 3 years old,called an Axial Flow Harvester. As well as traditional barley and wheat,crops now include rape & linseed.
